title: SOP Updates: Execution Mechanics, ER/VAR Exception Handling, and Closure Requirements

comment:
REVIEW FINDINGS FOR CR-014

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'SOP Updates: Execution Mechanics, ER/VAR Exception Handling, and Closure Requirements' - VERIFIED PRESENT
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' - VERIFIED PRESENT (CR ID not required for v0.x per SOP-001 Section 5.1)

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE: All required CR sections present per SOP-002 Section 6.

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT: Placeholders exist in EI table editable fields and Execution Summary section. Per SOP-004 Section 4.1 and 5, these are intentional template markers for fields populated during IN_EXECUTION phase. Static fields are properly populated. CONFORMING.

DEFICIENCIES REQUIRING CORRECTION:

1. VAR-TEMPLATE REFERENCE WITHOUT DEFINITION
   Line 113 references 'VAR-TEMPLATE' in execution instructions but:
   - No execution item creates this template
   - No reference specifies where this template exists or will be created
   - VARs cannot be created without a defined template/structure
   
   REQUIRED: Either add an EI to create VAR-TEMPLATE, or remove the reference if VARs follow an ad-hoc format.

2. VAR/INV RELATIONSHIP NOT ADDRESSED
   The CR introduces VARs for 'all other executable documents' including INVs. However:
   - SOP-003 already governs deviation management for INVs
   - The relationship between VARs and SOP-003 deviation handling is not specified
   - Potential overlap/conflict between VAR exception handling and INV deviation management
   
   REQUIRED: Section 4.1 (SOP-004 Updates) should clarify how VARs relate to SOP-003, or explicitly exclude INVs from VAR scope.

3. VAR DOCUMENT TYPE NOT FULLY SPECIFIED
   EI-7 adds VAR to SOP-001 Section 3 definitions, but:
   - SOP-001 Section 2 lists document types in scope - VAR not mentioned
   - VAR workflow state (executable vs non-executable) not specified
   - VAR naming convention not specified (child document like CR-XXX-VAR-NNN?)
   
   REQUIRED: If VARs are controlled documents, Section 2.3 should include SOP-001 Section 2 update, and the implementation plan should specify VAR document type characteristics.

RECOMMENDATION: Request updates to address the three deficiencies above. The conceptual framework (ER/VAR distinction, Pass/Fail outcomes, Type 1/Type 2) is sound, but the implementation plan has gaps that would create ambiguity during execution.

REVIEW FINDINGS - CR-014 v0.1 (Re-Review)

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: 'SOP Updates: Execution Mechanics, ER/VAR Exception Handling, and Closure Requirements' - COMPLIANT
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' - COMPLIANT (v0.1 document)

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE:
- Section 1 Purpose: PRESENT
- Section 2 Scope: PRESENT (2.1 Context, 2.2 Changes Summary, 2.3 Files Affected)
- Section 3 Rationale: PRESENT
- Section 4 Implementation Plan: PRESENT (4.1, 4.2, 4.3 subsections)
- Section 5 Testing Summary: PRESENT
- Section 6 Execution: PRESENT (EI table with 9 items, comments sections)
- Section 7 Execution Summary: PRESENT
- Section 8 References: PRESENT

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT:
- No TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX found
- Execution phase placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) are acceptable for pre-review phase

PREVIOUS DEFICIENCIES - STATUS:
1. VAR-TEMPLATE Reference: RESOLVED - Line 115-116 now references 'SOP-004 Section 9A, to be added by this CR'
2. VAR/INV Relationship: RESOLVED - Implementation Plan 4.1.4 now clarifies 'VARs handle execution exceptions in-flight; INVs handle post-hoc quality events'
3. VAR Document Type: RESOLVED - EI-7, EI-8, EI-9 added to update SOP-001 Sections 2, 3, and 6.1 respectively

TRACEABILITY:
- 9 EIs map correctly to 9 Implementation Plan items
- All SOP references (SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-004) are valid
- Files Affected section matches Implementation Plan scope

FORMATTING:
- Consistent heading hierarchy
- Tables properly formatted
- No typos detected

RECOMMENDATION: APPROVE

POST-REVIEW VERIFICATION COMPLETE. Verified: (1) Frontmatter: CR-014 title='SOP Updates: Execution Mechanics, ER/VAR Exception Handling, and Closure Requirements', revision_summary='Initial draft'; SOP-004 revision_summary='CR-014: Add Pass/Fail outcomes, VAR framework, and updated closure requirements'; SOP-002 revision_summary='CR-014: Add VAR reference for CR execution exceptions'; SOP-001 revision_summary='CR-014: Add VAR to controlled document types, definitions, and naming conventions'. (2) All 9 EIs verified Pass with documented evidence: EI-1 through EI-9 implemented as planned. (3) Traceability confirmed - all three SOPs reference CR-014 in revision_summary. (4) No placeholder content found. (5) Execution Summary accurately reflects completed work. Recommend proceeding to post-approval.
